FuncDef:
The service-identify command configures the service identification mode.
The undo service-identify command cancels the configured service identification mode.
By default, there is no service identification mode.
CLIs: service-identify { inner-vlan | outer-vlan | dscp | dhcp-option60 | vendor-class }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that services are identified based on the inner VLAN ID.
-

Indicates that services are identified based on the outer VLAN ID.
-

Indicates that services are identified based on the DSCP value.
-

Indicates that services are identified based on the VENDOR-CLASS(DHCPv4 OPTION60/DHCPv6 OPTION16).
-

Indicates that services are identified based on the VENDOR-CLASS(DHCPv4 OPTION60/DHCPv6 OPTION16).
-

Indicates that services are identified based on the 802.1p field in the inner VLAN tag or the outer VLAN tag.
The parameter is supported only on the admin VS.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After you create a service identification policy by using the service-identify-policy command in the system view, you must run the service-identify command to configure the service identification mode for the policy.
For single-tagged VLAN packets from users, services can be identified based on the inner VLAN ID or the 802.1p field in the inner VLAN tag.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
